title: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. When editing XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that changes need to be saved. However, the error message is not clear and leaves the user uncertain of what action to take. The error message is titled 'Source page is dirty' (including the quotes). Additionally, the user is presented with the options to save or discard changes: 'Yes' to save the changes, 'No' to discard the changes, and 'Cancel' to do nothing and remain on the Source page. This dialog should provide a better title, without quotes. The following alternative behavior is suggested:XML Report Design has been modified.
OB: If you edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will receive an error message stating that the 'Source page is dirty' (including the quotes). This error message does not provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
EB: A better approach would be to display a clear error message without quotes, such as 'XML Report Design has been modified'. The dialog title should also be improved to provide more meaningful information.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer.
2. Edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.
3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Observe the error message and the available options to save, discard, or cancel the changes.
